page.title: 07ATTITUDES IN MOORSHOLM
page.content: Moorsholm welcomes the friendly newcomers but respects those who do not 'join in.' The established residents say 'Hello' to complete strangers & would be surprised not to get a response. Like a large family there is a strong feeling of belonging. There are no extremes of poverty or affluence. Vandalism is virtually unknown. It is a village of 'Good neighbours.' First impressions are of the cleanliness of the village, the lack of traffic and the gentle pace of life. On moving into the village, newcomers are overwhelmed by the friendliness and helpfulness of residents, the closeness of village life and the vast number of available activities. On the climatic side the strength of the wind is an outstanding feature.
